meanings.sent1: She miscoloured the sky purple instead of blue.
meanings.sent2: The artist accidentally miscoloured the tree leaves yellow instead of green.
meanings.sent3: The children miscoloured the grass pink for fun.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to miscolour the house with neon paint was a disaster.
meanings.sent5: The painter's mistake miscolouring the ocean made the whole scene look strange.

meanings.definition: Having the wrong color or shade.
meanings.sent1: The miscoloured dress stood out among the rest.
meanings.sent2: The miscoloured car looked out of place in the parking lot.
meanings.sent3: The miscoloured cupcakes brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: Her miscoloured hair was a topic of conversation at the party.
meanings.sent5: The miscoloured sky at sunset was a sight to behold.
